ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads

Class LightPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads.ThreadControl
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads.LightPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RGBPoller

    public class LightPoller
extends ThreadControl
    This class implements the Light Sensor Poller for our robot it runs pulls the sensor data every 50 miliseconds
    Author:
    Caspar Cedro, Percy Chen, Patrick Erath, Anssam Ghezala, Susan Matuszewski, Kamy Moussavi Kafi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightPoller(SampleProvider[] us, float[][] lgData, SensorData cont)
      This constructor creates an instance of the LightPoller class to provide distance data from an light sensor to our robot.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class ca.mcgill.ecse211.threads.ThreadControl

        isStarted, run, setStart, setWait, shouldWait, waitForThisThread

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightPoller

        public LightPoller(SampleProvider[] us,
                   float[][] lgData,
                   SensorData cont)
            throws OdometerExceptions
        This constructor creates an instance of the LightPoller class to provide distance data from an light sensor to our robot.
        Parameters:
        us - A SampleProvider class instance that helps us to store an array of light sensor data.
        lgData - An array to store light sensor data.
        cont - A SensorData object instance to further store sensor data.
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions
